meanings.definition: To remove dead skin cells from the surface of the skin.
meanings.sent1: She exfoliated her face to make it smoother.
meanings.sent2: I exfoliated my skin to reveal a fresh layer underneath.
meanings.sent3: After she exfoliated, her skin felt like a baby's bottom.
meanings.sent4: The old paint exfoliated from the wall, revealing the original color.
meanings.sent5: Exfoliating regularly helps keep your skin healthy and glowing.

meanings.definition: To come off in thin layers or scales.
meanings.sent1: The bark exfoliated from the tree trunk.
meanings.sent2: The old paint on the door exfoliated due to weathering.
meanings.sent3: The snake exfoliated its skin, leaving a trail of scales behind.
meanings.sent4: As the sun dried the mud, it exfoliated into fine powder.
meanings.sent5: The exfoliated layers of rock revealed a beautiful pattern underneath.

meanings.definition: To shed or peel off in flakes.
meanings.sent1: Her sunburned skin exfoliated in patches.
meanings.sent2: The old wallpaper exfoliated from the wall with ease.
meanings.sent3: The pastry exfoliated into delicate layers as it baked.
meanings.sent4: The exfoliated paint chips littered the floor after sanding.
meanings.sent5: The exfoliated leaves created a colorful carpet on the ground.
